targets.rawQuery:
SELECT  BIN(time,$interval)                                                      AS binned_timestamp
       ,"$label"
	,COALESCE( MAX(measure_value::bigint),MAX(measure_value::double) ) AS max_duration
       ,COALESCE( MIN(measure_value::bigint),MIN(measure_value::double) ) AS min_duration
       ,COALESCE( AVG(measure_value::bigint),AVG(measure_value::double) ) AS avg_duration
       ,measure_name, count() as task_rate_bin_$interval
FROM "metricsDB"."aggregated_metrics"
WHERE "$label" = '$val' AND measure_name='durationMs' and $__timeFilter
GROUP BY measure_name, "$label", BIN(time,$interval)
ORDER BY binned_timestamp ASC

SELECT 
       date_diff('second', from_milliseconds($__from), from_milliseconds($__to) ) as window
       ,count() as count
       ,SUM(measure_value::bigint)/1000 AS sumWallTimes
FROM "metricsDB"."aggregated_metrics"
WHERE "$label" = '$val' AND measure_name='durationMs' AND $__timeFilter

SELECT 
       MIN(measure_value::bigint) AS Shortest
       ,AVG(measure_value::bigint) as avg
       -- ,APPROX_PERCENTILE(measure_value::bigint, 0.05) AS p25
       ,APPROX_PERCENTILE(measure_value::bigint, 0.75) AS p75
       ,APPROX_PERCENTILE(measure_value::bigint, 0.95) AS p95
       ,MAX(measure_value::bigint) AS Longest
FROM "metricsDB"."aggregated_metrics"
WHERE "$label" = '$val' AND measure_name='durationMs' AND $__timeFilter

options.content:
CPU Analysis

The CPU Analysis chart shows the maximum and average percentage of CPU used by the tasks in each bin. A value closer to the "Detected Assigned Task CPU" is better. Ensure optimal CPU allocation by comparing assigned, maximum, and average values. Consider reducing the CPU assigned for tasks if the peak and average values are consistently under the CPU limit. If the chart shows peaks above the limit, the tasks might be using more CPUs than assigned if available in the VM.

- Detected Assigned Task CPU: The existing CPU allocation per task, adjustable based on task configurations.
- Avg of Peaks (Recommended CPUs) - This is the mean of all the maximum CPU values in all the tasks in the selected time window.

- Max CPUs Peak - The maximum CPU usage detected in this time.
- Maximum Average CPUs: The maximum measured CPU average among the tasks. This is the CPU value the tasks would need if the CPU usage were constant.

targets.rawQuery:
SELECT
    binned_timestamp
    ,maxCpuMaxPercentage/100  AS maxUse
    ,CAST(sumCpuTimeUsed AS DOUBLE PRECISION) / NULLIF(sumCpuTimeReserved, 0) * cpuAssignedCount AS avgUse 
    ,cpuAssignedCount as assigned
FROM 
    (SELECT 
        BIN(time, $interval) AS binned_timestamp,
        MAX(CASE WHEN measure_name = 'cpuMaxPercentage' THEN measure_value::double END) AS maxCpuMaxPercentage,
        MAX(CASE WHEN measure_name = 'cpuAssignedCount' THEN measure_value::bigint END) AS cpuAssignedCount,
        SUM(CASE WHEN measure_name = 'cpuTimeUsed' THEN measure_value::bigint ELSE 0 END) AS sumCpuTimeUsed,
        SUM(CASE WHEN measure_name = 'cpuTimeReserved' THEN measure_value::bigint ELSE 0 END) AS sumCpuTimeReserved
    FROM 
        "metricsDB"."aggregated_metrics"
    WHERE 
        "$label" = '$val' AND 
        measure_name IN ('cpuTimeUsed', 'cpuTimeReserved', 'cpuMaxPercentage', 'cpuAssignedCount') AND 
        $__timeFilter 
    GROUP BY 
        BIN(time, $interval)
    ) AS aggregated_data
ORDER BY 
    binned_timestamp ASC

panels.description:
Î£ CPU Time Reserved=amount of cores reserved multiplied by the duration of the task.
Î£ CPU Time Used=The CPU time used by all the tasks
Î£ CPU Time Waste=The remaining time that the CPUs were reserved for this task but were not used 100%.

targets.rawQuery:
SELECT 
       -- SUM(if(measure_name='durationMs', measure_value::bigint)) AS SumDurationMs
       SUM(if(measure_name='cpuTimeReserved', measure_value::bigint)) AS SumCpuReserved
       ,SUM(if(measure_name='cpuTimeUsed', measure_value::bigint)) AS SumCpuTimeUsed
       ,SUM(if(measure_name='cpuTimeUsed', measure_value::bigint))-SUM(if(measure_name='cpuTimeReserved', measure_value::bigint)) AS SumCpuTimeWaste
       FROM "metricsDB"."aggregated_metrics"
       WHERE "$label" = '$val' AND ( measure_name='cpuTimeUsed' OR measure_name='cpuTimeReserved' OR measure_name='durationMs') and $__timeFilter
       GROUP BY "$label"
       
-- [ "memoryAvg", "memoryMax", "memoryLimit", "cpuTimeThrottled", "cpuAvgPercentage", "cpuMaxPercentage", "durationMs", "cpuAssignedCount", "cpuTimeReserved", "cpuTimeUsed" ]

SELECT 
       MAX(if(measure_name='cpuAssignedCount', measure_value::bigint)) as max_assigned
       ,AVG(if(measure_name='cpuMaxPercentage', measure_value::double))/100 AS avg
       ,MAX(if(measure_name='cpuMaxPercentage', measure_value::double))/100 AS max
       ,MAX(if(measure_name='cpuAvgPercentage', measure_value::double))/100 AS max_average
FROM "metricsDB"."aggregated_metrics"
WHERE "$label" = '$val' AND ( measure_name='cpuAvgPercentage' OR measure_name='cpuMaxPercentage' OR measure_name='cpuAssignedCount') and $__timeFilter
GROUP BY "$label"

options.content:
Memory Analysis

Provides memory allocation recommendations based on the maximum memory values utilized by tasks. Use this to prevent "OutOfMemory" errors and optimize resource use. - Max Memory Used (Min Recommended) - Suggests allocating memory above this value to prevent task failures and ensure stable operation. This is the peak memory usage detected in each time bin. This value does not consider memory used for cache. - Memory Limit (Reserved) - Represents the reserved memory detected for each bin. Only the maximum value is shown if multiple limits are found.

- Max Memory Used (Min Recommended)  - Suggests allocating memory above this value to prevent task failures and ensure stable operation. This is the peak memory usage detected in each time bin. This value does not consider memory used for cache.
- Memory Limit (Reserved) - Represents the reserved memory detected for each bin. Only the maximum value is shown if multiple limits are found.

targets.rawQuery:
SELECT 
       MAX(if(measure_name='memoryLimit', measure_value::bigint)) AS limit
       ,MAX(if(measure_name='memoryMax', measure_value::bigint)) AS max
FROM "metricsDB"."aggregated_metrics"
WHERE "$label" = '$val' AND ( measure_name='memoryLimit' OR measure_name='memoryMax') and $__timeFilter
GROUP BY "$label"

SELECT 
  BIN(time, $interval) AS binned_timestamp,
  "$label",
  MAX(CASE WHEN measure_name='memoryMax' THEN measure_value::bigint END) AS peak,
  MAX(CASE WHEN measure_name='memoryLimit' THEN measure_value::bigint END) AS limit
FROM 
  "metricsDB"."aggregated_metrics"
WHERE 
  "$label" = '$val'
  AND measure_name IN ('memoryAvg', 'memoryMax', 'memoryLimit')
  AND $__timeFilter
GROUP BY 
  "$label", 
  BIN(time, $interval)
ORDER BY 
  binned_timestamp ASC
SELECT * FROM "metricsDB"."aggregated_metrics" where "$label" = '$val' AND $__timeFilter AND measure_name='durationMs'

list.description: The size of the bins in the timeseries data.
list.label: Resolution
list.name: interval

list.description: One of the labels associated to the metrics
list.label: Label
list.name: label

list.description: Group by the label having this value
list.label: Value
list.name: val
